children.subject: Hi! Karina and I worked on the Diversity and Inclusion section of the presentation, and we're happy to contact you to talk more about it.

Is there anyone I can talk to about the Diversity and Inclusion aspect of this presentation? I'd be interested in having a conversation with the person who created those slides and talk about ideas for the following presentation to faculty. My email is mariela.hdz@berkeley.edu. Thanks

Because he originally set this document up to be private (staff and faculty only), I would not want to release it without his permission. Please reach out to him directly if you're interested in this.

Professor Garcia's advice about group advising on the second-to-last slide seem to not be authorized for normal .berkeley.edu access. Could we open these permission settings up to be viewed?

https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Protected/Faculty/GroupAdvisingAdvice.html

history.content:
Remember that really long survey that we asked y'all to complete during winter break? In addition to supplying information needed for the department's 10 year Academic Program Review, twelve student representatives reviewed the 240 pages of data and created a presentation for the faculty about the big issues facing undergraduates in our department. The presentation included concrete suggestions for how our faculty can help create a more welcoming, inclusive, and supportive climate for CS majors/minors, EECS majors/minors, CS-intended students, and other folks who interact with our department. So thank you all for filling out the survey, and thank you to Kaitlyn, Annie, Karthik, Lavanya, Vishnu, Vivien, William, Aniruddha, Karina, Suraj, & Lindsay.
 
Slides here: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1zlQ6TtKGIRlzyIwRRW5RY8JByIxDEMmnRfEO9lQTo30/edit?usp=sharing
If you chose to comment, please be respectful. As a reminder, students are not permitted to be anonymous to admins/instructors.
